{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Including clouds"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Powerlaw cloud models"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "To be added soon."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Gray cloud deck and/or scaled Rayhleigh scattering"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Let's initialize an atmosphere in the usual way, see [\"Getting Started\"](getting_started.html):"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "  Read CIA opacities for H2-H2...\n",
      "  Read CIA opacities for H2-He...\n",
      " Done.\n",
      "\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "from petitRADTRANS import Radtrans\n",
    "\n",
    "atmosphere = Radtrans(line_species = ['H2O', 'CO_all_iso', 'CH4', 'CO2', 'Na', 'K'], \\\n",
    "      rayleigh_species = ['H2', 'He'], \\\n",
    "      continuum_opacities = ['H2-H2', 'H2-He'], \\\n",
    "      wlen_bords_micron = [0.3, 15])\n",
    "\n",
    "pressures = np.logspace(-6, 2, 100)\n",
    "atmosphere.setup_opa_structure(pressures)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<div class=\"alert alert-warning\">\n",
    "\n",
    "**Units in petitRADTRANS:** remember that all units in *petitRADTRANS* are in cgs, **except for pressure**, which is in bars, **and the mean molecular weight (MMW)**, which is in units of atomic mass units.\n",
    "</div>"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Next we set up the atmospheric parameters, with a parameter selection identical to the [\"Getting Started\"](getting_started.html) case."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {
    "collapsed": true
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from petitRADTRANS import nat_cst as nc\n",
    "R_pl = 1.838*nc.r_jup_mean\n",
    "gravity = 1e1**2.45\n",
    "P0 = 0.01\n",
    "\n",
    "kappa_IR = 0.01\n",
    "gamma = 0.4\n",
    "T_int = 200.\n",
    "T_equ = 1500.\n",
    "temperature = nc.guillot_global(pressures, kappa_IR, gamma, gravity, T_int, T_equ)\n",
    "\n",
    "abundances = {}\n",
    "abundances['H2'] = 0.74 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['He'] = 0.24 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['H2O'] = 0.001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['CO_all_iso'] = 0.01 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['CO2'] = 0.00001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['CH4'] = 0.000001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['Na'] = 0.00001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['K'] = 0.000001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "\n",
    "MMW = 2.33 * np.ones_like(temperature)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<div class=\"alert alert-warning\">\n",
    "\n",
    "**Abundances in petitRADTRANS:** remember that abundances in petitCODE are in units of **mass fractions**, not number fractions (aka volume mixing ratio, VMR). You can convert between mass fractions and VMRs by using\n",
    "\\begin{equation}\n",
    "X_i = \\frac{\\mu_i}{\\mu}n_i,\n",
    "\\end{equation}\n",
    "where $X_i$ is the mass fraction of species $i$, $\\mu_i$ the mass of a single molecule/atom/ion/... of species $i$, $\\mu$ is the atmospheric mean molecular weight, and $n_i$ is the VMR of species $i$.\n",
    "\n",
    "</div>"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Let's calculate three spectra:\n",
    "-  A clear model\n",
    "-  A cloudy model with a gray cloud deck at 0.01 bar\n",
    "-  A haze-like model, mimicked by scaling the Rayleigh scattering of the gas by a factor 10\n",
    "-  A combination of the two above cloud models: gray cloud deck plus haze"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {

ynVCmhgp5RqDruxzYbdWiUtz96NCbbuwxgR2Q1MBDLK\nMhpj9mALqrKMMT/a09Zh6yrdYj/nXaoEXs7kqcG9wGsisgvb+LSyrs+N2CZLVJw84Yx/Aol1yF/V\nQ8Age/1TgX5VM9g/k8ftdfwaSDXGrLlEuX8um2yBLbj+2p4+yF5npVQrIOUt8koppaoSkQ7GmLP2\n148DVxpjHmpAeVcCy40xw1xVx8Zin6X8GfAL+1g9pVQLp2PslFKqdiNE5I/YnpeHgV83pDBjzI/2\nZVU61WUtu2byM+BxDeqUaj20xU4ppZRSqo3QMXZKKaWUUm2EBnZKKaWUUm2EBnZKKaWUUm2EBnZK\nKaWUUm2EBnZKKaWUUm3E/wcra4qpcjg0UgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<matplotlib.figure.Figure at 0x1168d90b8>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import pylab as plt\n",
    "plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (10, 6)\n",
    "\n",
    "# Clear\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_transm(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, R_pl=R_pl, P0_bar=P0)\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, \\\n",
    "         atmosphere.transm_rad/nc.r_jup_mean, label = 'Clear')\n",
    "\n",
    "# Gray cloud deck at 0.01 bar\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_transm(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, R_pl=R_pl, P0_bar=P0, \\\n",
    "                      Pcloud = 0.01)\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, \\\n",
    "         atmosphere.transm_rad/nc.r_jup_mean, label = 'Gray cloud deck at 0.01 bar')\n",
    "\n",
    "# Haze (10 x gas Rayleigh scattering)\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_transm(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, R_pl=R_pl, P0_bar=P0, \\\n",
    "                      haze_factor = 10)\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, \\\n",
    "         atmosphere.transm_rad/nc.r_jup_mean, label = 'Rayleigh haze')\n",
    "\n",
    "# Haze + cloud deck\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_transm(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, R_pl=R_pl, P0_bar=P0, \\\n",
    "                      haze_factor = 10, Pcloud = 0.01)\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, \\\n",
    "         atmosphere.transm_rad/nc.r_jup_mean, label = 'Rayleigh haze + cloud deck')\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.xscale('log')\n",
    "plt.xlabel('Wavelength (microns)')\n",
    "plt.ylabel(r'Transit radius ($\\rm R_{Jup}$)')\n",
    "plt.legend(loc = 'best')\n",
    "plt.show()\n",
    "plt.clf()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Condensate clouds from real optical constants"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Let's calculate some spectra using opacities derived from optical constants of various materials.\n",
    "In this example we will start of with forsterite, that is $\\rm Mg_2SiO_4$. For the list of available cloud species see [\"Available opacity species\"](../available_opacities.html)."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<div class=\"alert alert-info\">\n",
    "\n",
    "**Choose your favorite particle setup:** petitRADTRANS offers multiple opacity versions for every given condensate, assuming either spherical (Mie scattering) or irreagularly shaped (DHS method = distribution of hollow spheres) particles. Moreover, opacities assuming a crystalline and/or amorphous internal structure can be used, where available.\n",
    "\n",
    "</div>"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We set up the atmosphere like before, this time loading the opacity of crystalline (``c``), irregularly shaped particles (DHS method, abbreviated ``d``). The mode identifier for the $\\rm Mg_2SiO_4$ opacity therefore is ``Mg2SiO4(c)_cd``. ``(c)`` stands for condensed. These are all possible modes, note that for some species only crystalline or amorphous cross-sections are available."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "| Opacity code | Description |\n",
    "|------|------|\n",
    "|  Species(c)_cm  | crystalline Mie opacity of Species|\n",
    "|  Species(c)_cd  | crystalline DHS opacity of Species|\n",
    "|  Species(c)_am  | amorphous Mie opacity of Species|\n",
    "|  Species(c)_ad  | amorphous DHS opacity of Species|"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "But now, let's start! We simply give one additional ``cloud_species`` list to the Radtrans object, containing the name of the opacity species we want to use."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "  Read CIA opacities for H2-H2...\n",
      "  Read CIA opacities for H2-He...\n",
      " Done.\n",
      "\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "from petitRADTRANS import Radtrans\n",
    "\n",
    "atmosphere = Radtrans(line_species = ['H2O', 'CO_all_iso', 'CH4', 'CO2', 'Na', 'K'], \\\n",
    "      cloud_species = ['Mg2SiO4(c)_cd'], \\\n",
    "      rayleigh_species = ['H2', 'He'], \\\n",
    "      continuum_opacities = ['H2-H2', 'H2-He'], \\\n",
    "      wlen_bords_micron = [0.3, 15])\n",
    "\n",
    "pressures = np.logspace(-6, 2, 100)\n",
    "atmosphere.setup_opa_structure(pressures)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<div class=\"alert alert-warning\">\n",
    "\n",
    "**Units in petitRADTRANS:** remember that all units in *petitRADTRANS* are in cgs, **except for pressure**, which is in bars, **and the mean molecular weight (MMW)**, which is in units of atomic mass units.\n",
    "</div>"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Next we set up the atmospheric parameters, with a parameter selection *almost* identical to the [\"Getting Started\"](getting_started.html) case. We now also add the mass fraction of the cloud species we are interested in. Note that the mass fractions only contains the name ``Mg2SiO4(c)`` now, the ``_cd`` suffix has to be omitted."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "metadata": {
    "collapsed": true
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from petitRADTRANS import nat_cst as nc\n",
    "R_pl = 1.838*nc.r_jup_mean\n",
    "gravity = 1e1**2.45\n",
    "P0 = 0.01\n",
    "\n",
    "kappa_IR = 0.01\n",
    "gamma = 0.4\n",
    "T_int = 200.\n",
    "T_equ = 1500.\n",
    "temperature = nc.guillot_global(pressures, kappa_IR, gamma, gravity, T_int, T_equ)\n",
    "\n",
    "abundances = {}\n",
    "abundances['H2'] = 0.74 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['He'] = 0.24 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['H2O'] = 0.001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['CO_all_iso'] = 0.01 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['CO2'] = 0.00001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['CH4'] = 0.000001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['Na'] = 0.00001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['K'] = 0.000001 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "abundances['Mg2SiO4(c)'] = 0.0000005 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "\n",
    "MMW = 2.33 * np.ones_like(temperature)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<div class=\"alert alert-warning\">\n",
    "\n",
    "**Abundances in petitRADTRANS:** remember that abundances in petitCODE are in units of **mass fractions**, not number fractions (aka volume mixing ratio, VMR). You can convert between mass fractions and VMRs by using\n",
    "\\begin{equation}\n",
    "X_i = \\frac{\\mu_i}{\\mu}n_i,\n",
    "\\end{equation}\n",
    "where $X_i$ is the mass fraction of species $i$, $\\mu_i$ the mass of a single molecule/atom/ion/... of species $i$, $\\mu$ is the atmospheric mean molecular weight, and $n_i$ is the VMR of species $i$.\n",
    "\n",
    "</div>"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Setting the cloud particle size"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "We have to define a few additional parameters for the clouds, to start the calculation.\n",
    "We can give the mean particle size and width of the log-normal particle distribution:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "radius = {}\n",
    "radius['Mg2SiO4(c)'] = 0.00005*np.ones_like(temperature) # I.e. a 0.5-micron particle size (0.00005 cm)\n",
    "\n",
    "sigma_lnorm = 1.05"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Now, let's calculate a clear and cloudy spectrum to compare:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {

       "<matplotlib.figure.Figure at 0x11b0ab6a0>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "atmosphere.calc_transm(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, \\\n",
    "                       R_pl=R_pl, P0_bar=P0, \\\n",
    "                       radius = radius, sigma_lnorm = sigma_lnorm)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, atmosphere.transm_rad/nc.r_jup_mean, label = 'cloudy', zorder = 2)\n",
    "\n",
    "abundances['Mg2SiO4(c)'] = np.zeros_like(temperature)\n",
    "\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_transm(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, \\\n",
    "                       R_pl=R_pl, P0_bar=P0, \\\n",
    "                       radius = radius, sigma_lnorm = sigma_lnorm)\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, atmosphere.transm_rad/nc.r_jup_mean, label = 'clear', zorder = 1)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.xscale('log')\n",
    "plt.xlabel('Wavelength (microns)')\n",
    "plt.ylabel(r'Transit radius ($\\rm R_{Jup}$)')\n",
    "plt.legend(loc='best')\n",
    "plt.show()\n",
    "plt.clf()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Here one sees that there is a lot of additional absorption in the optical and near-IR. Also note the silicate (Si-O stretching mode) becoming visible at 10 micron."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "### Calculating the particle size"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Alternatively, one can specify an eddy diffusion parameter ($K_{zz}$, with units of cm$^2$/s), which expresses how strongly atmospheric mixing is. The cloud particle size is then controlled by specifying $K_{zz}$, and the unitless settling parameter $f_{\\rm sed}$, which expresses the particles' mass averaged settling velocity, when compared to the local atmospheric mixing speed. Also, a width for the log-normal particle size distribution must be specified:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "metadata": {
    "collapsed": true
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "Kzz = np.ones_like(temperature)*1e1**7.5\n",
    "fsed = 2.\n",
    "sigma_lnorm = 1.05"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Again, let's calculate a clear and cloudy spectrum to compare:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",

   "source": [
    "abundances['Mg2SiO4(c)'] = 0.0000005 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_transm(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, \\\n",
    "                       R_pl=R_pl, P0_bar=P0, \\\n",
    "                       Kzz = Kzz, fsed=fsed, sigma_lnorm = sigma_lnorm)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, atmosphere.transm_rad/nc.r_jup_mean, label = 'cloudy', zorder = 2)\n",
    "\n",
    "abundances['Mg2SiO4(c)'] = np.zeros_like(temperature)\n",
    "\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_transm(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, \\\n",
    "                       R_pl=R_pl, P0_bar=P0, \\\n",
    "                       Kzz = Kzz, fsed=fsed, sigma_lnorm = sigma_lnorm)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, atmosphere.transm_rad/nc.r_jup_mean, label = 'clear', zorder = 1)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.xscale('log')\n",
    "plt.xlabel('Wavelength (microns)')\n",
    "plt.ylabel(r'Transit radius ($\\rm R_{Jup}$)')\n",
    "plt.legend(loc='best')\n",
    "plt.show()\n",
    "plt.clf()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "The resulting mean particle sizes can be accessed like this:"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",

      "text/plain": [
       "<matplotlib.figure.Figure at 0x11b18e6d8>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "abundances['Mg2SiO4(c)'] = 0.0000005 * np.ones_like(temperature)\n",
    "\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_flux(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, \\\n",
    "                       Kzz = Kzz, fsed=fsed, sigma_lnorm = sigma_lnorm)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, atmosphere.flux/1e-6, \\\n",
    "         color = 'black', label = 'cloudy', zorder = 1)\n",
    "\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_flux(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, \\\n",
    "                       Kzz = Kzz, fsed=fsed, sigma_lnorm = sigma_lnorm, \\\n",
    "                       add_cloud_scat_as_abs = True)\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, atmosphere.flux/1e-6, \\\n",
    "         label = 'cloudy, add scattering to absorption', zorder = 2)\n",
    "\n",
    "abundances['Mg2SiO4(c)'] = np.zeros_like(temperature)\n",
    "\n",
    "atmosphere.calc_flux(temperature, abundances, gravity, MMW, \\\n",
    "                       Kzz = Kzz, fsed=fsed, sigma_lnorm = sigma_lnorm)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.plot(nc.c/atmosphere.freq/1e-4, atmosphere.flux/1e-6, '-', \\\n",
    "         color = 'red', label = 'clear', zorder = 0)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.legend(loc='best')\n",
    "plt.xscale('log')\n",
    "plt.xlabel('Wavelength (microns)')\n",
    "plt.ylabel(r'Planet flux $F_\\nu$ (10$^{-6}$ erg cm$^{-2}$ s$^{-1}$ Hz$^{-1}$)')\n",
    "plt.show()\n",
    "plt.clf()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Here we plotted the clear spectrum, neglecting the cloud opacity, the cloudy spectrum only considering the absorption of the cloud particles (petitRADTRANS does not include scattering in its emission spectra), and the cloudy spectrum resulting from adding 20 % of the cloud scattering opacity to the absorption opacity (toggled by setting the keyword argument ``add_cloud_scat_as_abs = True``). Because the two latter cases differ quite strongly, we can see that in the case studied here, petitRADTRANS should not be used to calculate emission spectra."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "<div class=\"alert alert-warning\">\n",
    "\n",
    "**Scattering and petitRADTRANS:** remember that scattering is not included for emission spectra in petitRADTRANS (but it is for the transmission spectra). We plan to migrate the scattering implementation of __[petitCODE](https://home.strw.leidenuniv.nl/~molliere/#petitcode)__ to petitRADTRANS soon.\n",
    "\n",
    "</div>"
   ]
  }
